column1: Little Goat Diner////We put our names in and waited the hour to get seated
column2: and brunch was worth the wait. We luckily didn't get seated at the communal table. Our party of 4 was in a comfortable booth. I ordered the spicy ginger ale and it hit the spot. I love the unique flavors and creative dishes. I got the Breakfast Spaghetti 'N Clams 'N Crabs and it was surprised me in a great way. I tasted the other 3 dishes that my girlfriends got and really liked them as well - the Bull's Eye French Toast
column3: the Kimchee & Bacon & Eggs & Pancakes Asian Style Breakfast Tasty Thing
column4: and the Shrimp & Grits. The little goat coffe was pretty good even without the sugar
column5: and that's saying something to me who usually always has coffee with some type of sugar in it. Somehow the goat milk gave the coffee flavor which took on a more complex taste than regular cow's milk. I would love to come back here and try other items on the menu. Our waitress was friendly and helpful with recommendations. The prices are a bit higher
column6: but the unique and creative dishes are worth it!
